projects.title: Low particle Emissions and lOw Noise Tyres
projects.objective:
As car and truck engines have become quieter and cleaner over the past decades, particulate and noise emissions from road-tyre interaction have become the dominant source of traffic-generated particulate emission and traffic noise. Both particulates (airborne or as microplastics) and noise are suspected to contribute to negative health outcomes for those living near busy roads.
Currently, non-exhaust particulate emissions are not regulated. Tyre noise is subject to labelling for passenger vehicl
projects.countries_list: BE, CN, DE, ES, FR, NL, SE
projects.keywords: Tyre noise, particulate emissions, tyre wear, cardiovascular health, particulate measurements, airless tyre, quiet tyre, particulate matter, traffic noise, microplastics, noise exposure, air quality

projects.title: Digital Scores – investigating the technological transformation of the music score
projects.objective: Digital scores utilising computational technology and digital media are emerging worldwide as the next evolutionary stage in the concept of the music score (Vear 2019). Yet there has been no scientific study of digital scores; nor their effect upon creativity and musicianship. This is remarkable for two reasons:  First, because digital scores are generating new music experiences, innovative compositional approaches, novel performance opportunities, and broader accessibility for a vast number of
projects.keywords: Music scores,  performance practice, computational technology
projects.all_org_names: DE MONTFORT UNIVERSITY, CENTRAL CONSERVATORY OF MUSIC, MONASH UNIVERSITY, THE UNIVERSITY OF NOTTINGHAM, THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, CONCORDIA UNIVERSITY

projects.title: Assessing Sectoral Perspectives on Climate Transitions to support the Global Stocktake and subsequent NDCs
projects.objective: The NDC ASPECTS project will provide inputs to the Global Stocktake under the Paris Agreement (PA) and support the potential revision of existing Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) of the PA’s parties, as well as development of new NDCs for the post 2030 period. The project will particularly focus on four sectoral systems that are highly relevant in terms of the greenhouse gas emissions they produce yet have thus far made only limited progress in decarbonization. projects.countries_list: BE, CN, DE, EL, ES, FI, FR, ID, IN, RU, US, ZA
projects.keywords: Sectoral perspective,  energy-intensive industry,  transport & mobility,  AFOLU,  buildings,  transformation,  decarbonization,  sectoral pathways
